etymologies: late Middle English (originally as two words, denoting public welfare; compare with commonweal): from common+ wealth

definitions: an independent country or community, especially a democratic republic.
an aggregate or grouping of countries or other bodies

examples.text: a union or commonwealth of democratic, self-governing countries

definitions: a community or organization of shared interests in a nonpolitical field
a self-governing unit voluntarily grouped with the US, such as Puerto Rico

examples.text: the island became a commonwealth of the United States in 1986

definitions: a formal title of some of the states of the US, especially Kentucky, Massachusetts, Pennsylvania, and Virginia.
the title of the federated Australian states.
the republican period of government in Britain between the execution of Charles I in 1649 and the Restoration of Charles II in 1660.
shortDefinitions: republican period in Britain after execution of Charles I

definitions: an international association consisting of the UK together with states that were previously part of the British Empire, and dependencies. The British monarch is the symbolic head of the Commonwealth.
shortDefinitions: association consisting of UK and former members of British Empire
